main event: Three observers in Colorado Springs and Denver reported a sighting of one object on December 11, 1955. The object was described as green with an orange trail and much brighter than jet exhaust.
interesting points: The observation was made by both military and civilian sources, adding credibility to the report.
The object was tracked on ground radar, indicating a tangible presence.
The USAF initially identified the object as a meteor, but it was later labeled as 'definitely not' a meteor, suggesting uncertainty in the explanation.
The object's abnormal brightness and color set it apart from typical atmospheric phenomena.
The brief duration of the sighting (3-5 seconds) suggests a rapid and unusual movement pattern.
sighted object: one green object with an orange trail
photographs: no, the report does not include photographs
